text: randomizing a list in python manually
Here's some code for shuffling a deck of cards manually.
I understand it up to the point where cards[pos], cards[randpos] = cards[randpos], cards[pos].
What is the point of assigning cards[pos] to cards[randpos]?
self.cards is a list of playing cards in standard order.

code:
def shuffle(self):
        n = len(self.cards)
        cards = self.cards
        for pos in range(n):
            randpos = randrange(pos,n)
            cards[pos], cards[randpos] = cards[randpos], cards[pos]
